CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 4, 1951, page 3, reads: "Ground Breaking At Bedford Dwellings - Deputy Mayor Howard B. Stewart breaks ground for the 460-unit addition to Bedford Dwellings as other local officials look on. They are, left to right: Harold F. Burnworth, Housing Authority board member; James S. Devlin, director of the city Department of Public Works; Clarence C. Klein, administrator of the Housing Authority, and Richard F. Jones, vice chairman of the Housing Authority board of directors. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Deputy Mayor Howard B. Stewart wearing dark tie and eyeglasses, holding shovel at groundbreaking ceremony for addition to Bedford Dwellings, with small crowd of women and men, including from left: Harold F. Burnworth, James S. Devlin, Clarence C. Klein, and Richard F. Jones, vertical format
